name: Phase_L_Audit_Checklist
purpose: Lock and audit PXL-governed planning design prior to any runtime implementation.

authority_binding: Planning authority is explicitly derived from PXL
No secondary or heuristic authority sources exist
All planning admissibility gates reference PXL constraints
planning_definition: Planning is defined as a logical transformation only
Plans are information artifacts, not executive acts
Plans do not grant or imply execution authority
admissibility_gates: Domain legitimacy gate restricts plans to PXL-admitted domains
Boundedness gate requires declared tick limits
separation_of_concerns: Planner role is distinct from executor role
Planner cannot approve its own plans
negative_capability_lock: Absence of these capabilities is intentional and documented
cross_domain_scope: Planning may reference all PXL-admitted domains
Domain expansion is a separate governed act
drift_prevention: Phase-L artifacts are frozen prior to runtime work
Any change requires explicit phase advancement

exit_requirements_for_phase_m: All checklist items reviewed and marked satisfied
New governance tests authored for planning runtime
Explicit authorization to enter Phase-M recorded
notes: Failure to satisfy any item blocks progression to planning runtime implementation.
